ETYMOLOGY: From machine + -ery. 'Machine' from Old French machine, from Latin machina 'device, contrivance', from Greek makhana. The suffix '-ery' denotes a collection or a place.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. Uncountable nouns do not have a plural form.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Machines or mechanical parts of a machine, regarded collectively.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 机器或机械部件的总称。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The factory invested heavily in new machinery to increase production efficiency.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这家工厂投入巨资购买新机器以提高生产效率。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. Uncountable nouns do not have a plural form.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An organized structure or system by which something is done or managed.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 组织或系统，尤指用于达成特定目的的结构或运作方式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The machinery of government can be slow to adapt to new challenges.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 政府的运作机制可能难以适应新挑战。

REGISTER: Formal to neutral, used in technical, industrial, and administrative contexts.
